duties_responsibilities.duty: Identify and implement process and system improvements for procurement operations.
Track and report relevant performance and compliance metrics for procurement processes.
Develop, implement, and maintain cross-functional procedures to track and improve the end-to-end sourcing process and compliance.
Monitor and report statutory and regulatory compliance, including CDP and contract compliance for key categories.
Provide training related to internal policies, procedures, and external laws and regulations for procurement personnel.
Create and maintain a process for sharing best practices across locations and businesses.
Monitor source-to-pay process metrics, identify opportunities to streamline and standardize processes.
Collaborate in an international and remote team, fostering collaboration with procurement teams and other stakeholders.
Manage deviations from standard processes and ensure compliance with procurement policy and procedures.
Support and ensure purchasing activities align with ESG, KAITEKI, and HSE principles.
Report to the regional Head of the Center of Excellence and potentially trainees/student workers.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, engineering or other STEM discipline, or equivalent experience combined with education.
